definition: one's regular job
first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive
surname Ye
line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already
not to engage in honest work/to ignore one's proper occupation/not to attend to one's proper duties

sentences.english: On the move back to sister in law is for the sake of taking care of them all.
sentences.chinese: 正业向弟妹表明自己搬回来是为了照顾众人。

sentences.english: Having spent his youth inidleness, he is having to work in his old age.
sentences.chinese: 他年轻时不务正业，年老时非辛苦工作不可。

sentences.english: His Daxue Zhengye inherited and developed Yan and Li's theory.
sentences.chinese: 他的著作《大学正业》，继承了颜李学说并有所发挥。

sentences.english: He idled about and did no decent work.
Brother to work honestly, deceiving his wife often living on sisters relief.
sentences.chinese: 弟弟不务正业，瞒着妻子常靠姐姐的救济过日子。

sentences.english: He is always loafing around and doing nothing.
sentences.chinese: 他经常游手好闲，不务正业。

sentences.english: Zhengye counts many of China’s largest air conditioner producers as its customers.
sentences.chinese: 许多中国大型空调生产商都是正业国际的客户。

sentences.english: She had fondly loved her sinful but good-natured father.
sentences.chinese: 她很爱她的那个虽然不务正业而心地善良的父亲。

definition: business in which a company has traditionally engaged (e.g. before diversifying)/original business/core business/(literary) agriculture
not to engage in honest work/to ignore one's proper occupation/not to attend to one's proper duties
one's job
to idle about
lit. trifling destroys the will (idiom); infatuation with fine details prevents one making progress/excessive attention to trivia saps the will
to go dining, wining, whoring and gambling/to lead a life of dissipation
upstanding person/upright person
dishonest practices
to work for a living
to be distracted from one's work and fail to achieve results (idiom)
to enjoy life/pleasures of life
to study/to engage in scholarship
to love ease and comfort and hate work (idiom)
to fool around/to mess with/to do sth without a plan
(to play) one's part/one's role/one's duty/(to stay within) one's bounds/dutiful/keeping to one's role
to scrape a meager living/to get by with difficulty
variant of 糊口[hu2 kou3]
